Merge pull request #270 from tbranyen/2.0.0

WIP: 2.0.0
Fixes to Component class and css tweaks
Added a layout to minimize page repetition
Removed unused tasks, cleaned up build

Added Views and removed the styles Grunt plugin

The styles Grunt plugin was really cool, but I don't have time to
maintain it. Since it never left beta, I'm going to remove it in favor
of the Grunt contrib team's cssmin. If you want to use a preprocessor,
it's trivial to add.

I've added a bunch of application files to demonstrate how to integrate
the router, components, etc. into your application.

Removed all Jasmine and QUnit tests

Being more opinionated with Mocha and assert. Converted tests to ES6 as
well.

Removed Requirejs for Babel and Browserify

This kills the AMD and adds in the ES6.

Lots of changes

- Removed Bower in favor of NPM
- Removed grunt-bbb-server for grunt-connect
- Updated the README, LICENSE, and other meta-files.
- Added the watch task and NPM scripts.

Merge pull request #268 from spoonben/update-karma

Update karma to v0.12.0

Update karma to v0.12.0

Fix an error that occurs during the npm install process

Removing peerDependencies

While a good idea in theory, they are causing way too much trouble with
generator-bbb.  Currently since generator-bbb is listed as a peerDep to
Backbone Boilerplate and Backbone Boilerplate is a dependency of
generator-bbb, we have a circular dependency which causes problems when
you fix a bug in generator-bbb, but backbone boilerplate pulls the wrong
version and still breaks.

- Moved from vendor/bower to bower_components.

- Removed the need to findNestedDependencies.
- Corrected Mocha tests to adhere to the other implementations.
- Completely removed Compress task.

Upgraded Lo-Dash Template Loader and Mocha.  Updated readme.

Integrated PureCSS and Lo-Dash template loader.

Merge pull request #235 from backbone-boilerplate/better-testing

Removed all redundant testing markup; refactored to use a single set of files.

Removed all redundant testing markup; refactored to use a single set of files.

The redundant qunit, mocha, and jasmine test folders that contained
separate index.html, test-runner.js, and specs.js files has been reduced
to a single: test/runner.js.

The test runner will now automatically find any of your test files
(suffixed with .spec.js) no matter where you store them in the
filesystem and you no longer have to manually specify them, they just
load! (Kudos to the Angular team for this feature in Karma).

To switch testing framworks you need to alter only two locations in the
Gruntfile and then you can immediately start coding tests in that
framework

The two operating modes are now:

``` bash
grunt karma:daemon
```

This mode will block your terminal and display test output every time
you save.

``` bash
grunt karma:run
```

Will run the tests only once, useful as part of a build process or
continuous integration.

Experimental testing changes that greatly improve the workflow.

Updated to use latest Karma and added in coverage plugin.  No longer
need to run the server to execute the tests.
Use correct styles min file path.
Reverted back to modules, no infrastructure to build components baked in.
Rename modules/ to components/ and remove templates/

Tracking WIP changes.
Removed outdated line from the README.
Fix Mocha to run in browser and node tests.  This is most likely a bug with karma-mocha.
Switched over to the grunt collection.
Life is good, all test harnesses using the latest official grunt-karma and all latest testing libraries.
Renamed bootstrap to main and made the bower output silent.
Restored config file option and added a comment into Router.
Renamed output to source.min.js and fixed a comment.
Bumped bbb-server dependency to latest version.

Migrated testing libraries.  Started updating tests to work with latest grunt-karma.  Removed grunt-compress.  Added grunt-processhtml.  Updated server configuration to use the new prefix setting instead.
More file renames to be more obvious.  Updated Grunt RequireJS configuration to try and be more simple.

Removed JamJS (no longer maintained for the most part), removed all vendor dependencies (added a postinstall hook in NPM), added peerDependencies, removed LayoutManager, renamed main => bootstrap, started refactoring out redundant grunt tasks.
Don't create JST as LayoutManager cache processed templates internally
Make sure window.JST is declared before use

Merge pull request #155 from jugglinmike/link-opt

Increase hyperlink selector specificity

Increase hyperlink selector specificity

Delegating on a more specific selector makes this operation slightly
more efficient. Anchor tags without an "href" property are not
considered for overriding, precluding the need to wrap them in a jQuery
object.

Merge pull request #69 from andrewpthorp/master

Fixed a problem in the fetchTemplate jQuery.get() method.

Set dataType of fetchTemplate to "text."

This will ensure that the results of the jQuery.get() method come back as plain text. If you don't set this, the results of a simple layout with nothing but a block level element will return as a Document Object.
